page.title: 12WEST FELTON RELIGION
page.content: THERE ARE TWO CHURCHES AND TWO CHAPELS IN THE WEST FELTON AREA.THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST.MICHAEL'S ORIGINATED IN NORMAN TIMES AND WAS ADDED TO IN GEORGIAN AND VICTORIAN TIMES.THE PRESENT RECTOR IS THE REV.J.TALBOT WHO LIVES IN THE MODERN RECTORY BUILT ON THE SITE OF THE OLD STONE RECTORY.THERE IS A SMALL STONE CHURCH HALL AT THE END OF THE GROUNDS. THE METHODIST CHAPEL IS A MORE MODERN BRICK BUILDING,WITH A SUNDAY SCHOOL ROOM ADDED MORE RECENTLY.IT HAS A THRIVING SUNDAY SCHOOL AND SERVICES ARE TAKEN BY VISITING MINISTERS FROM THE AREA. PRADOE CHURCH IS A PRIVATE FAMILY CHURCH BUILT AND RUN BY THE KENYON FAMILY. THERE IS ALSO A SMALL BRICK CHAPEL AT WEIRBROOK AND THIS IS FINANCED BY AN ANNUAL CONCERT.
